div.l: Þis Iohn answered Aleyn avyse þe4188
Þis myller is a ꝑperelous man he seyde
And ȝif þᵗat he out of his slep abreyde4190
He myth don vs boþe a vilany
Aleyn answered I sette hym not at a flye
And vp he ryst ⁊and by þᵉ wench he crept
Þis wenche lay vprith ⁊and faste slept
Til he so nyh was or she myth aspye4195
Þat hit had be to late forte crye
And shortly forte say þei were at on
Now pley Aleyn for y y wyl speke of Iohn
Þis Iohn lyth stille a forlong wey or to
And to hymself he maketh reuth ⁊and wo4200
Allas qduod he þis is a wikked Iape
Now may I sey þᵗat I am but an ape
Ȝut hath my felawe somwhat for his harm̄
He hath þᵉ myller douht̉er in his arm
He euentured hym to haue his nedes sped4205
And I lyg as a draff sek in my bed
And when þis Iape is told an oþ̉er day
I shal be holden a daffard ⁊and Cokeney
I wyl aryse ⁊and aunter hit by my fayth
Vnhardy vnsely as men sayth4210
And vp he aros ⁊and softely he went
Vn to þᵉ cradel ⁊and softely in his armes hent
And sette hit softely at his beddes fete
Sone aft̉er þᵉ wyf here routynge lete
A can a wake ⁊and wente her to pisse4215
And cam agayn ⁊and can þᵉ cradel mysse
And groped here ⁊and þ̉ere but she fond non̄
